intro: Chionogentias muelleriana subsp. willisiana, commonly known as the Willis's snowbell, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are narrow and lanceolate, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to high-altitude ecosystems.
